data.body: as shown in #5588.

data.title: AI meta data
data.body:
Work done to make AI supportpower usage slightly smarter. Refer to #5830 

Allows some basic usage rules to be defined in yaml for supportpowers.

data.title: Attempted to read past the end of the stream
data.body:
I closed a game on my localhost, by clicking X from window and got this:

exception.log:

```
Red Alert Mod at Version release-20140608
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.1.7601 Service Pack 1)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.18444
Exception of type `System.IO.EndOfStreamException`: Attempted to read past the end of the stream.
   at OpenRA.StreamExts.ReadBytes(Stream s, Int32 count)
   at OpenRA.FileSystem.MixFile.ReadBlocks(Stream s, Int64 offset, Int32 count)
   at OpenRA.FileSystem.MixFile.DecryptHeader(Stream s, Int64 offset, Int64& headerEnd)
   at OpenRA.FileSystem.MixFile..ctor(String filename, PackageHashType type, Int32 priority)
   at OpenRA.FileSystem.GlobalFileSystem.OpenPackage(String filename, String annotation, Int32 order)
   at OpenRA.FileSystem.GlobalFileSystem.<Mount>c__AnonStorey29.<>m__7()
   at OpenRA.FileSystem.GlobalFileSystem.Mount(String name, String annotation)
   at OpenRA.FileSystem.GlobalFileSystem.LoadFromManifest(Manifest manifest)
   at OpenRA.ModData.PrepareMap(String uid)
   at OpenRA.Game.StartGame(String mapUID, Boolean isShellmap)
   at OpenRA.Game.LoadShellMap()
   at OpenRA.Mods.RA.Widgets.Logic.IngameMenuLogic.<IngameMenuLogic>c__AnonStorey111.<>m__30A()
   at System.Action.Invoke()
   at OpenRA.Primitives.ActionQueue.PerformActions()
   at OpenRA.Game.Tick(OrderManager orderManager)
   at OpenRA.Game.Run()
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)
```

server.log:

```
Order lag is now 3 frames.
Order lag is now 1 frames.
Order lag is now 3 frames.
Order lag is now 1 frames.
Order lag is now 3 frames.
Order lag is now 1 frames.
Order lag is now 3 frames.
Order lag is now 1 frames.
Initial mod: ra
Initial map: 18517ca00f89a4266044acdb2e4ec5569b335cec
Client 0: Accepted connection from 127.0.0.1:60832.
Order lag is now 3 frames.
Order lag is now 1 frames.
Player @127.0.0.1:60832 is NotReady
Dropping client 0 because reading the data failed: System.Net.Sockets.SocketException (0x80004005): An existing connection was forcibly closed by the remote host
   at System.Net.Sockets.Socket.Receive(Byte[] buffer, Int32 offset, Int32 size, SocketFlags socketFlags)
   at OpenRA.Server.Connection.ReadDataInner(Server server)

```

data.title: Fix RepairBuilding not working for AI and Lua scripts
data.body: Fixes #5861

data.title: Ending a mission is glitchy
data.body:
The commit SHA: d1e18cad7ab4fcad524f9dbecedb48d469d08286 in #5640 seems to have broken the ending in missions.  When a mission ends, the game is force-paused and the 'mission accomplished' or 'mission failed' sounds are played.

The first problem is fixed by #5862.  The second problem is that the sounds now get played multiple times, layered on top of one another, creating a sort of echo effect.  Also you FMV viewer does not properly disappear after the video ends but only shows a black screen. You need to press ESC a couple of times to return to the game.

data.title: TD UI plays click sounds and animations twice
data.body: I'm not sure whether this is intentional, but to me it feels wrong. Both the click sound and fade animation for checkboxes appears to play twice in rapid succession when you click once. This is not the case for any other mod.

data.title: Old Lua: use the correct method to set the pause state
data.body: #5640 changed the methods that pause the game. This fixes the old Lua API to account for that change.

data.title: Bots will start and stop repairing immediately
data.body:
Nothing is getting repaired. I guess the notice hitting twice means he started and then issued again which negated it. 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/756669/3495413/5bfd963a-05d6-11e4-9e6b-71d8c69cdb42.png)

data.title: News fixes
data.body: Fixes #5603 and #5647.

data.title: Improve paratroopers.
data.body:
- Adds support for multiple drop planes.
- Adds support a beacon and camera.
- Prevents the plane from circling if it can’t unload

data.title: Units/Vehicles footprints
data.body:
IRC discussion:
http://logs.ihptru.net/?year=2014&month=01&day=20#22:34:42

![footprints](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1732773/3492559/17f1cf8a-05ac-11e4-950e-16c0aaecca3b.png)

It might make sense to add footprints for SNOW or DESERT maps.

data.title: Removed unneccessary build-top sequences from Dune 2000
data.body: The factories don't have doors and the refinery does not produce any units. In the future this all wants to be replaced by a https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Traits#withroof that is included into RenderPreview.

data.title: D2k Some Footprint Fixes
data.body: I fixed the problem at refinery and added moveable places at top corners of palace and refinery.

data.title: D2k one wall+ ref and palace footprints
data.body:
The walls are the same and i removed the other walls and it can be helpful for #5747

Also Refinery and Palace footprint was problemed. They have moveable places at corners.

data.title: Add beacons to the RA spy plane and parabombs
data.body:
![spybeacon](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/3491696/22a0f116-059a-11e4-9b48-fbc2a826877a.png)

This also removes some redundancy by using AirstrikePower for the spy plane.

Note: Paratroopers is getting a proper rewrite, and will be its own pr.

data.title: Sped up ActorMap.ActorsInBox.
data.body: The `HashSet` in `ActorsInBox` was causing the whole function to be fairly slow. By ensuring the partitioning bins will contain distinct actors we can avoid the set and that speeds up `ActorsInBox` nearly 3x. To ensure we have only distinct actors, we just need to make the add/remove lists into sets.

data.title: Speed controls should be enabled when observing bot-only games.
data.body: This would make it much easier to test AI changes, especially after #5850 lands.

data.title: Speed up shroud checks
data.body:
This improves shroud-related performance.

There are two key changes in this PR:
- Carried over from #5542, shroud is only updated within the visible screen region. When scrolling on large maps this prevents a lot of wasted work being performed to update the whole shroud to prep it for rendering since most of it will be thrown away when the shroud changes before it can be used anyway.
- The refactored `GetEdges` method accepts a delegate for the visibility function. This removes the duplicate code between `FoggedEdges` and `ShroudedEdges` but also allows an optimization by allowing the delegate to be specialized. About 50% of the work done in calls to `IsVisible` or `IsExplored` are the initial checks that the cell is within the map boundary and if the shroud or fog is even enabled. We can avoid repeating these checks by providing a delegate valid over certain cell regions. We can check the map bounds and shroud/fog visibility once upfront and then a faster delegate that just does the core work can be used. In the common scenario where all the cells are in bounds and shroud/fog is enabled the fast core work only delegate is about twice as fast. Since it gets called in loops this makes shroud-related checks about twice as fast. In practise, scrolling around a fair amount on a medium-sized map at the start of a game with a bunch of AI saw the `RenderShroud` method take up 28% of CPU time, with 11% being the `Update` method. This PR reduced that to 21% with 5% being the `Update` method.

data.title: Improve the game loop
data.body: It can now skip frames. Replays are a _lot faster_ on the "max speed" setting.

data.title: Fixed active animations playing during paused games
data.body: This slipped through, because I did https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5806 and https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5640 next to each other.

data.title: Categorized shellmaps
data.body: This is another uncontroversial commit from https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/4496 that was easy to split. I reuse the map load widget for my ingame editor which allows to browse by categories. This groups them in their own category which makes them easier to find or avoid.

data.title: Fixed the sietch crashing the game when placed on a map
data.body: Noticed during testing of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/4496. It looks like bit rot as the `Sprite` field does not exist anymore on https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Traits#bib. Not sure why OpenRA.Lint did not pick this up. https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Game/GameRules/ActorInfo.cs#L81

data.title: New lua api should write something in lua.log
data.body:
~~Currently I even doesn't write something in the chat.~~ #6188
That makes it more difficult to find errors in the script.

data.title: Added Media.AddChatLine to the new Lua API
data.body: Unmerged part of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5469.

data.title: Added Blossom Trees to Tiberian Sun
data.body: The last major resource related gameplay element that was missing.

data.title: Lua script (new API) won't be loaded
data.body:
Map.yaml:

```
[...]
Rules:
    World:
        LuaScript:
            Scripts: testscript.lua
[...]
```

testscript.lua:

```
print("hi")
WorldLoaded = function()
    print("loaded")
end
```

Ingame:
![luaapifail](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7704140/3489403/6a3ab0f8-052b-11e4-8b44-917858505254.png)

No message is printed.
I really don't know what went wrong.

```
Red Alert Mod at Version release-20140608
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.1.7601 Service Pack 1)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.18444
Exception of type `System.IndexOutOfRangeException`: Index was outside the bounds of the array.
   at OpenRA.WorldUtils.GetTerrainType(World world, CPos cell)
   at OpenRA.Mods.RA.Effects.Missile.Tick(World world)
   at OpenRA.World.<Tick>m__11C(IEffect e)

```

data.title: Rocket infantry stays out of firing range
data.body:
I noticed that when you order a TD rocket trooper to fire on te ground outside of its weapon range, it will only move closer but not start firing. Looks like it stays about 1 cell out of weapon range.

data.title: Fixed a NullReferenceException in auto map download.
data.body: Spotted while testing https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5839. Introduced by https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/commit/a30c8b53a7ed8735ec55688ec0769774af76fb4a#diff-7. This fix may create wrong spawn point preview positions for not yet downloaded isometric maps.

data.title: depend on proper status in auto-downloading
